solution.text:
draw OT parallel to AB
By using the theorem we can say, in \(\bigtriangleup \) DAB \(\frac {AO}{OD}=\frac {Bt}{Dt}\)
Now in \(\bigtriangleup \)BCD, \(\frac {OB}{OC}=\frac {Bt}{Dt}\)
equating the two equations we get
\(\frac {OA}{DO}=\frac {OB}{OC} \Rightarrow \frac {OA}{OB}= \frac {OD}{OC}\)
it is given that \(\frac {AO}{OB}=\frac {_{j}_}{_{{j+2}}_}\)
therefore, \(\frac {OD}{OC}=\frac {_{j}_}{_{{j+2}}_}\)

content.text:
The diagonals of a quadrilateral ABCD intersect each other at the point O
Given that \(\frac {AO}{OB}=\frac {_{j}_}{_{{j+2}}_}\) and AB is parallel to CD.
Choose the correct statements from the options given below.
